result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were revoked, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Hearing on May 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Exhibit 1

Defendant Michael L Probst in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The State calls Dr. Robert VerWert and the witness is sworn in.  The State conducts direct examination of the witness.   Attorney Morin conducts cross examination of the witness.  The witness is excused.  Both parties conduct closing statements.  The State moves Exhibit #1 into evidence.  The Court admits Exhibit #1 into evidence.  The State rests.  The Court finds the Defendant is not competent to proceed and is ordered to be admitted for inpatient treatment and finds the Defendant is incompetent to refuse medication. The Court to prepare an order for commitment for treatment.    The Defendant is remanded into custody.   THE COURT ORDERS THAT THE DEFENDANT RECEIVE HIS PRESCRIPTION MEDICATION AS PRESCRIBED.  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Michael L Probst in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin advises the Court the Defendant was administratively discharged from Drug Treatment Court.  Attorney Morin requests the Court order a competency exam to be conducted by Dr. Verwert. The Court advises the Defendant bail remains as set.  Review hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael L Probst in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1.  Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.  The Defendant is to remain in Custody at the Waukesha County Jail.
